events.name: Day of Healing: Amplify & Energize
events.description:
Soak in the energetic pleasure of the Summer season and divulge in the delight and goodness of your body with self-care guided by your favorite Chicago practitioners!

Comfy Fitness + Acts of Ritual are once again hosting a full Day of Healing where participants will take on loving and being in AWE of their bodies. Whether you're looking to amplify the bounty this Summer has already delivered, or you're looking to coax it into existence, this space is created for you. Choose classes ala carte or stay the whole day!

Not to worry: snacks, refreshments and CHOCOLATE will be provided!!

On the menu:

- A (Re)Introduction to Your True Strength (9:30 - 10:45am)
facilitated by Kira Macoun

- Tune into Relaxation & Pleasure with Biofield Tuning (11:00 - 12:15pm)
facilitated Karen Yates

- Pause for Pleasure: a Forrest Yoga practice (1:00 - 2:15pm)
facilitated by Anna Schabold

- Full Body Stress Release: a Return to Inner Freedom & Presence (2:30 - 3:45pm)
facilitated by Carrie Drapac

- Breathing into Expansion: Group Energy Healing (4:00 - 5:15pm)
facilitated by Lindsay Hopkins

Check out the ticketing link for class descriptions!

Full-Day Pass buyers automatically receive a 26% discount .
Use code PLEASUREBOOST to get 10% off a your selection of 2,3, or 4 classes.

Find tickets for full day or ala carte here:
events.how_to_find_us: On Damen Ave, just north of Armitage. Closest train is Damen Blue Line stop and bus is the Damen #50.

events.name: We Run, We Brunch
events.description:
We meet at Hashbrowns Gold Coast (1200 N, 200 W) at 10:00 a.m. We will start running from the Hashbrowns at 10:10 a.m. continuing on to our regular "north-on-the-lakefront" route for 30 minutes, then turning around and running back to Hashbrowns for another 30 minutes.

We will take a count for brunch seating then head out for an hour-long run/walk/mosey/meander. The exercise part is for TIME, not distance. We all end up at the same place, at the same time.

Why do we go to Hashbrowns? Why don't you go someplace different every week like [insert other running group here]?

1) I'm stupid lazy and just can't be bothered to go somewhere different every week. 2) Hashbrowns gives us the VIP treatment - we don't wait for a table, it's preset; we don't have to fumble around for cash to split out a huge bill, they split our checks. 3) If it ain't broke, don't fix it, just tip the server who makes all this convenience possible.

To receive CANCELLATION notifications, you MUST be subscribed to Organizer Messages. Please adjust your privacy settings accordingly.
events.how_to_find_us: We're wearing a LOT of spandex.  Easy to spot.

This event is open to all involved in or interested in Gor in the Chicago area and its surroundings.

events.name: Sunday Indoor Volleyball Tournament - Intermediate (B)+ at WCF - Noon
events.description:
Calling all Intermediate Level (B) Volleyball Players and higher! Join us for 2 full hours of action in this pickup game. Great for people who need a flexible schedule and just want to play or for people looking to get some extra practice in for their leagues. Our Grab A Game host will check players in, create teams, and make sure everyone has a great time. All you have to do is show up ready to play.

Rec players should check out our other recreational (C) events. We have a strict skill-level policy to guarantee a quality playing experience for our participants.

Not sure what level you are? Check out our descriptions by clicking here.
When in doubt, start at the Recreational (C) games and work your way up. Ask the event host to give you an assessment to gauge which level is best for you.

Pricing - pre-pay will be available once we know for sure we have enough people for a game. The host will post a comment with instructions on how to pre-pay when the option is available.
$15 - RSVP online and pay in advance (speedy check-in!)
$15 - RSVP and pay cash at the event (if space is available)

As of March 2018, each Grab A Game Participant must fill out our online waiver. It only needs to be completed once for all Grab A Game groups and games. If you have not yet filled out this waiver, please complete it before attending this event:

What to Wear
We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect
Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins.

Click here for Complimentary Injury Screen from Athletico.

Level of Play
This event is open to intermediate level players. The host will have a conversation with attendees who may be a better fit with one of the other levels. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information
Windy City Fieldhouse is located at Logan and Western. It has several courts for different sports. Make sure you check which court we are playing on listed in the "how to find us" section above.

Transportation
There is free parking in the parking lot along the side of Windy City Fieldhouse and in the Target parking garage! Please do not park in the Target parking lot. Also, be careful parking along the fence near the Target Parking log as those are metered spots.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 8 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count!
If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account.

Cancellations and Credits
Credits are not automatic. To request a credit, please contact lynn{at}ChicagoSocial.com and include the date and name of event.

Refunds will be issued if we cancel this event due to not having enough to play.

Requirement to play
This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio.

What's included in the price?
Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions?
Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 9:00am-5:00pm:[masked].
events.how_to_find_us: Court 4 (triple court)

events.name: Open Shop Time
events.description:
MAKE! Chicago is a community workshop with woodworking, welding, and metal fab tools. We offer affordable access to local artists and craftsman to explore, learn, create and grow.

During Open Shop, authorized guests have access to our tools, space to work, and assistance from our staff and other community members to help take on larger, more ambitious projects.

If you have a DIY project you've been meaning to get to, need a push in the right direction on how to build or fix something, or just don't have the tools to take on a new project, OPEN SHOP TIME is what you need in your life!

Restore an old dresser! Reupholster old dining chairs! Build a table from old pallets! Lathe turn a home-made bat! Grab a pile of scrap metal and do some recreational welding! Create stretcher bars for a canvas! Grab a friend for creative bonding time.

Whatever your project or idea, we have the tools and know how to help you be creative and successful.

Guests may arrive and go anytime between 12 and 6. But we recommend getting to the shop as early as you can to make the best use of the space and get your money's worth.

Prerequisites: You must have been through the shop authorization and signed a waiver to enter the space and do work. Authorizations are every fourth Tuesday of the month from 7 - 8:30. If you really can't wait that long, we'll work something out.

Fees: $45 per person per day. We can accept cash, check, Chase Quick-Pay or Venmo.

Materials included: LIMITED consumables are available, such as glue, screws, scrap wood and sandpaper. You must bring your own wood, metal, specialty materials, hardware, stains and finishes, consumables, etc.

Instruction: This activity is self directed. We will point you in the right direction and assist as needed. But you are in charge of planning, designing and building your project.

A bit of advice: Make a plan and come prepared! Choose a project and make clear goals. Gather up the materials you need beforehand. Do some research on what you are trying to do. And feel free to reach out to us if you need assistance planning. We'll do the best we can to help.

Hope you can MAKE! it.
events.how_to_find_us: Please call MAKE Chicago from the intercom to be let in.

events.name: Sunday Afternoon Lake Michigan Skyline Yacht Cruise - Get tix starting at $10!

events.description:
Get out on a boat for the perfect Sunday afternoon and catch breathtaking views of the Chicago skyline with 400 people! There's literally nothing better than riding a yacht out onto Lake Michigan to soak up a warm summer day, and this is absolutely the least expensive (yet still amazing and nice) way to do it!

I got them to hook us up with cheap tickets for this day, and we can get tickets starting at JUST $10 with promo code 'S3'! (full price is normally $50) BUT our code becomes worth less and the price goes up as more are sold so get yours ASAP. They ALWAYS sell out well before we hit the water.

Use code 'S3' for our exclusive discount and get your tickets here:

Tickets include: Your boarding pass, a live DJ, Giveaways & Dancing of course! There will be several full cash bars on board.

Boarding begins at 12:15 pm and sets sail at 1:00 pm sharp. Be on time so the boat doesn't leave without you!

These boats always fill up so our group's RSVP number won't show how many are actually coming. There's always super fun and friendly people on board, and Meetup groups hang out on the top deck to be social and meet others, so it's a really fun environment :)

---------------------------------------

FAQs:

What is the dress code? There is NO Dress code for the boat.

Can I bring my own food/drink on the boat? Absolutely no outside food or beverage may be brought on the boat.

What do I need to bring to get on the boat? Your printed ticket from Eventbrite and a valid ID. All guests must Be 21+.

How do I get to the boat? Please see the ticket page for a map and a detailed list of directions.

What kind of music will be played on the boat? The DJ will start with Top40, EDM, and Hip-hop and will play a variety of music with the goal of helping everyone enjoy themselves.

WHERE TO BOARD THE BOAT AND HOW TO GET THERE: There are TONS of directions on how to get there, where to park, etc, etc, etc, on the ticket page so check it out there!

---------------------------------------

GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THE PRICE GOES UP AS MORE ARE SOLD!!

Use code 'S3' for our exclusive discounted tickets starting at $10 and get em here:

events.name: Sunday Afternoon Book Group
events.description:
THE HOUSE OF MIRTH
By Edith Wharton

Pulitzer Prize-winning American author Edith Wharton used her inside knowledge of upper class New York life in the early part of the 20th century as the basis for her 1905 novel, “The House of Mirth”. The novel is the classic and tragic portrayal of Lily Bart, an intelligent New York socialite during the Victorian era, who seeks to secure a husband and a place in the society life of New York’s upper class. Lily, who was raised to strive for a socially and economically prosperous marital union, finds herself at the edge of thirty, her youthful beauty fading and her matrimonial prospects dwindling. The novel follows Lily’s descent down the social ladder over a period of two years as she circles the margins of New York’s upper class drawing closer to what seems an inevitable loneliness. Central to the theme of the novel is how the Victorian era offered women relatively few other alternatives to achieve upward social and economic mobility than through marriage. A classic depiction of a bygone era, “The House of Mirth” is at once a detailed portrait of New York society life and a social satire which harshly criticizes the moral failings of the rich.

Paperback, 351 pages; first published June 12th 1905. (CA)

events.name: KonMari 101: Tidy your home. Change your life.
events.description:
Chicago’s first certified KonMari Tidying Consultant Kristyn Ivey will share home organization tips that focus on what you keep (does it “spark joy?”), rather than what or how much you discard.

Learn about the revolutionary Japanese decluttering method made popular by Marie Kondo in her bestseller The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up.

This workshop will help you lead with gratitude and become an extension of a home that you honor and respect. It includes an overview of KonMari fundamentals and practical decluttering tips on handling clutter that falls under the signature KonMari categories: Clothing, Books, Paper, Miscellaneous items, Sentimental items. Enjoy a live demonstration of the KonMari Folding technique. We'll also discuss common myths and missteps as we address your specific clutter challenges and address any barriers to success and true abundance.

*BONUS*
Each participant will leave with a For the Love of Tidy KonMari Fold Drawer Liner and a copy of The Tidy Map: A Roadmap to Planning Your KonMari Tidying Journey.

*RAFFLE*
Workshop participants will have a chance to win a copy of The Life-changing Magic of Tidying Up and the second installment, Spark Joy!

*COST*
$15 suggested donation

ABOUT SPEAKER: Kristyn Ivey
For the Love of Tidy is Chicago’s first professional organizing consultancy specializing in the KonMari Method™ of tidying up. We help clients put their home, mind, and life in order once and for all through this revolutionary technique, based on the Japanese art of decluttering and organizing made popular by Marie Kondo’s bestselling book The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up. The method focuses on what you choose to keep (does it “spark joy?”), rather than what or how much you discard, donate, or sell.

For the Love of Tidy provides in-home KonMari Tidying Lessons and virtual Joy Checks to those committed to changing their life by tackling clutter comprehensively. Viewed as a permanent solution to creating and maintaining a clutter free living environment, tidying lessons that address Clothing, Books, Papers, Komono (miscellaneous), and Sentimental Items make up a special, one-time Tidying Series, executed over a six month period. Decluttering by category, rather than room, through a lens of joy leaves clients feeling empowered to live their lives efficiently, moving in the direction of their true passion, purpose, and joy. Magic!

*MORE INFORMATION*

events.name: Theory of Socialism and Capitalism - Hans-Hermann Hoppe
events.description:
Live reading of Hans-Hermann Hoppe's Theory of Socialism and Capitalism (reading every 3-5 pages and then stopping for discussion). We will cover chapter:

****Chapter 7: The Ethical Justification of Capitalism and
Why Socialism Is Morally Indefensible . . . . . . 147*****

Free ebook and description

Here is Hans Hoppe's first treatise in English — actually his first book in English — and the one that put him on the map as a social thinker and economist to watch. He argued that there are only two possible archetypes in economic affairs: socialism and capitalism. All systems are combinations of those two types. The capitalist model he defines as pure protection of private property, free association, and exchange - no exceptions. All deviations from that ideal are species of socialism, with public ownership and interference with trade.

Within the structure of socialism, he distinguishes the left and right version. "Conservative" socialism favors high regulation, behavioral controls, protectionism, and nationalism. The "liberal" version tends more toward outright public ownership and redistribution.

The consequences of socialism vary based on their degree and kind, but they have similarities: high costs, resource waste, low growth.

Additionally,

The second part of the book also introduces Hoppe's Argumentative Ethics, which is in my opinion, the most revolutionary development in the history of ideas.

events.name: Spring Chime Series
events.description:
Spring time is here! Just as daffodils break ground and move upward and outward, so does liver qi move in the body. If our liver qi is unbalanced, this movement will cause irritation, anger and bad moods. Also common are headaches at the top of the head, elevated blood pressure and tendon problems. In this series we will cleanse and strengthen the liver, and promote blood circulation to encourage free and smooth flowing qi.

The health of the liver affects the level of qi in the body. It stores and detoxifies the blood and maintains the efficient circulation of qi, influencing emotions, metabolism, and free flow of blood. The tendons and sinews are impacted, controlling movement of the limbs. The eyes are the opening of the liver allowing for clear crisp vision, and manifests in the nails. When liver qi is smooth there is a sense of purpose and direction in life, and the ability to make decisions.

We will end with a sound healing meditation, using Himalayan singing bowls.

Cost $18
or
try $20 for 2 weeks, and exlpore other class offerings!

events.name: Beer And Locksmith Design
events.description:
I want to make a meetup of all web designers and share the tools and tips each of us is using in his projects.

For the past 3 weeks i had to work with several web designers that each of them had their own way of understanding whats locksmith is and how to present it to the customers, the problem is that most of the locksmith owners in Chicago are more old fashion and less updated about the web design trends and tricks, so each of us suposed to find his own way to come to a compromise with the clients.

I would like to meet more people that dealing with similar problems and to learn some new ways of thinking cause as we all know - the same old ways of thinking gets the same old result. You can visit Panda Locksmith website and check out our work

events.description:
60-Minute Yoga Fusion Class - All Levels

As featured on WGN's S.E.E. Chicago, in the Chicago Tribune and in Chicago’s RedEye

Join us for a 60-minute Yoga Fusion class, followed by a delicious craft beer tasting. Stick around to sample all the latest brews at On Tour. Tickets include a 60-minute yoga session and a 16 oz. pour of your choice at the conclusion of the class. Buy a ticket to one session or all of them — each class is different!

We continue our Summer Series by shifting gears. Fresh off of a full moon and amidst the warmest time of year, this July session focuses on staying cool when the heat is on. When the going gets tough, what's your go-to? Do you fight yourself? Do you fight others? Do you check out? Do you melt? By recognizing and confronting our usual patterns of response to stress, we're one step closer to reclaiming neutrality and keeping cool.

Classes begin promptly at 10:00AM and last one hour. Each class is priced at $18.

Get tickets on Eventbrite

What to Bring: Mat, Water Bottle, Small Towel

***Please arrive 10-15 minutes early to sign in and secure a spot***

events.name: Emily Brontë's Wuthering Heights

venue.name: The Bourgeois Pig
venue.address_2: 1 ½ blocks east of the Fullerton Brown/Purple/Red Line Stop, on Fullerton. Exit the El, walk east toward Lake Michigan

group.name: Modernist Fiction, Its Origins and Beyond... and other stuff

events.description:
• What we'll do
To commemorate the bicentennial of Emily Brontë's birth on July 30, 2018, I hope you can join us in discussing Wuthering Heights.

Wuthering Heights is Emily Brontë's only novel. Written between October 1845 and June 1846, Wuthering Heights was published in 1847 under the pseudonym "Ellis Bell"; Brontë died the following year, aged 30. Wuthering Heights and Anne Brontë's Agnes Grey were accepted by publisher Thomas Newby before the success of their sister Charlotte's novel, Jane Eyre. After Emily's death, Charlotte edited the manuscript of Wuthering Heights, and arranged for the edited version to be published as a posthumous second edition in 1850.

Although Wuthering Heights is now widely regarded as a classic of English literature, contemporary reviews for the novel were deeply polarised; it was considered controversial because its depiction of mental and physical cruelty was unusually stark, and it challenged strict Victorian ideals of the day regarding religious hypocrisy, morality, social classes and gender inequality.

--From Wikipedia.

Hi everyone,

A bunch of us are planning to carpool from Vernon Hills to downtown Chicago for the Chicago SummerDance. Each summer, our great city hosts free ballroom dance (salsa, waltz, swing, etc.) lessons, followed by live music and dancing. This Sunday's lesson is swing.

Our carpool will leave at around 2 PM so that we have time to find parking (be sure to RSVP so that we can provide further instructions to you for the carpool).

• 4:00 - 5:00 PM - SummerDance dance lesson begins (swing)

• 5:00 - 7:00 PM - live music & dancing (we can leave anytime)

Be sure to RSVP so that we know how many people are coming (4-5 people per car).

events.name: Beach Frisbee and Sunset Kayak
events.description:
This is a must do event for Summer !

Only open to paid members of HiYak Adventures at special discounted rental rate. Guests are welcome to attend, but must pay in person Hiyak annual fee to participate.

We will gather on the beach and play some Frisbee while we all find parking and trek over the nice fine beach sand !

Then at 5:45 pm, we are going to launch from the Montrose Beach on Kayaks , cruising along the Coast line in the blue waters of Lake Michigan. We will be in 1-3 foot waves at all times, so you will get splashed and wet at some point for sure.
Gather for a group picture in the water , then paddle back along the Coast and head in to the beach with the Sun starting to set behind the buildings. Sunset beach approach at 7:00 pm.

Weather expected to be 80 degree and cloudy, buty could cool off to 68-72 at nite.

**** Parking is a Bear, sometimes you might have to park farther away and just hoof it in. I encourage Public Transportation.
If you do find parking, be prepared to walk at least 1/2-1 mile to arrive at our spot on the beach, so travel lightly.
################################################
You will head to Blue and White building, there is a Beach bar on one end, bathrooms in the middle and Kayak Chicago on far south end.
Head towards the middle of the building, coming out straight from bar, walk out onto the Beach and to the edge of the Dunes , go slight left near wooden boardwalk that heads to water( small fenced area with tall grass after the Volleyball nets,near several Sailboats parked on beach and you should see my American Flag planted in ground !

@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

You can choose to arrive early or late, but you must check in with me by 4:00pm.

@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

Cost will be $ 35.00 each. ** Paid members of Hiyak Adventurers only ( plus tx) This will be be paid as Group at one time after you check in with me.

* This event will only be canceled if weather is bad at 5:00.

events.name: The Dispossessed  by Ursula Le Guin

group.name: Read the Classics - The 1001 Books Challenge

events.description:
From Goodreads:

A tale of two worlds.
In her most ambitious and prophetic novel to date, Ursula K. Le Guin has produced a stunning tour de force - the spellbinding story of Shevek, a brilliant physicist who single-handedly attemps to re-unite two planets cut off from each other by centuries of distrust.

Anarres, Shevek's homeland is a bleak moon settled by an anarchic utopian civilization; Urras, the mother planet, is a world very similar to Earth, with its warring nations, great poverty, and immense wealth. Shevek risks everything in a courageous visit to Urras - to learn, to teach, to share. But his gift becomes a threat...and in the profound conflict which ensues, Shevek must re-examine his philosophy of life.

Wild Backpacking in Iceland
events.description:
• What we'll do
Wild Backpacking in Iceland
Trip Dates: July 30-August 6, 2018

Trip Location: Iceland

Details: Backpack in Iceland through canyons, mountains, and glaciers with our Women Only, Small Group Adventure Tour in Iceland. Trek through the hinterlands of Iceland surrounded by a varying landscape including sharp mountains, glaciers, lagoons, lava plains, steep canyons, rivers, and waterfalls. Experience the long days and the midnight sun of an Icelandic summer. Bask in the peace and quiet of a route that sees very little traffic avoiding the overcrowded trails of the summer on your 8 day/7 night backpacking trip in Iceland.

Four nights and five days will be spent deep in the wilderness of Iceland where only your two feet can take you. You’ll hike the canyons carved by the Núpsá river scrambling up cliff sides and overlooking roaring waterfalls. You’ll cross lava plains pink with the blooms of Arctic River Beauty flowers. You’ll spot floating ice bergs in glacier lagoons. You’ll trek for an entire day across the Skeiðarárjökull Glacier. You’ll climb, cross, and descend mountains yellow with rhyolite. You’ll finish your backpacking journey with a night camping in Vatnajökull National Park and a side trip to Svartifoss waterfall. On your final day in Iceland, you’ll soak in the soothing waters of Blue Lagoon before bidding farewell to Iceland.

Adventure Highlights:
• Enjoy the solitude backpacking in a remote and back country region of Iceland with less traffic
• Hike along the canyons on the Núpsá river with steep walls, roaring waterfalls, and the occasional, exciting scramble up a cliff side
• Spend an entire day crossing the Skeiðarárjökull Glacier (You can’t do that on the AT or PCT!)
• Cross narrow mountains ridges and descend into valleys formed with the yellowish rhyolite
• Side trip to Vatnajökull National Park’s most iconic landmark, Svartifoss waterfall
• Experience the long days and midnight sun of Icelandic summers
• Camp in the most scenic camp sites in Vatnajökull National Park
• Trek through a varied landscape including lava plains, glaciers, mountains, valleys, lakes, rivers, and canyons
• Re-energize with a soak in the geothermal waters of the Blue Lagoon and soften your skin with a silica face mask post backpacking
• Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Bad Ass women!

See website for full details and to book.

events.name: Official Club Hockey at MB Arena (MUST RSVP to ATTEND)
Food Pantry for Veterans, at the Jesse Brown VA Medical Center
events.description:
Come join the American Red Cross as we help distribute food to Veterans at the Jesse Brown VA Medical Center food pantry.

The VA food pantry operates on the vision of Veterans helping Veterans. Many of the Veterans at this pantry are homeless or disabled. This is your opportunity to show kindness and express gratitude to the brave men and women who served and sacrificed for our country.

The Mission: To honor and support those who have served our country by improving Veteran's access to nutritionally adequate food and by providing a place for continued social contribution.

Vision: Our goal is to alleviate hunger within the Veteran community and create a Veteran volunteer force with civic pride and comradery.

We will meet at The Jesse Brown VA medical center at 8 AM to setup tables and food. This pantry runs on a very tight schedule. All volunteers must report in by 8:15 A.M. to receive your assignment or else you may not be able to participate. Please allow yourself an extra 15 minutes to park and walk to the pantry area of the big building complex.

If you take public transportation, the Damen bus stops right in front of the building at 820 S. Damen Ave. From the main entrance, follow the blue signs to get to the Ogden elevators, then go up to the second floor, and then follow the brown signs to the Damen Pavilion. We will meet and setup in the main corridor. If you drive, you can use their paid garage and get free parking validation after the event via the Volunteer Services office on the 4th floor. Entrances to the parking garage is on Taylor street and Ogden Ave.

No open toe shoes allowed for safety reasons. Wear non slip bottom shoes like sneakers please. Volunteers will be given gloves to use when handling non packaged food.

The Greater Chicago Food Depository will supply the food and volunteers get to unbox, sort, and arrange the food to tables. We will then provide assistance to Veterans that wants help as personal shoppers. The food pantry opens at 11 AM to 1 PM. After the event, we will then help close down the pantry, break down and recycle boxes, and pack any left over food onto a van to help another homeless shelter near by.

This is a self select food pantry. The Veterans will have a choice to pick what food they want. Volunteers will help as personal shoppers, as many Veterans will have physical disabilities and your help will be much appreciated. This is also an opportunity to get to know them and share kind words with them. After all the Veterans have been served, we will help clean up and break down boxes for recycling. We should wrap up by 1:00 PM or maybe earlier.

If you are a Veteran or know of any Veteran that needs help with food supplement, please let them know of this service at the Jesse Brown VA medical center.

The Jesse Brown Veterans Food Pantry, is a partnership between the Greater Chicago Food Depository, AmeriCorps, and the Jesse Brown VAMC. The pantry is one of the first programs of its kind offering Veterans a "Client Choice" model pantry. Client choice is a model of food distribution that enables Veterans to select their own food, much like a grocery store. Unlike most pantries, which provide clients with fixed boxes or bags of food with no ability to select the items included, client choice pantries allow clients the ability to choose from a wide variety of foods, better enabling clients to meet their personal dietary needs. Client choice also ensures a sense of dignity for clients and their families, higher satisfaction with the food they are able to choose, less waste, and greater opportunities for volunteers and clients to interact with the mission and vision of the organization in mind.

The American Red Cross exists to provide compassionate care to those in need. Our network of generous donors, volunteers and employees share a mission of preventing and relieving suffering, here at home and around the world, through five key service areas: Disaster Relief, Supporting America’s Military Families, Health and Safety Training, Lifesaving Blood, and International Services. For more information, please visit

<

Transportation and Car pooling: We encourage our volunteers to be green whenever possible or practical. Public transportation (bus, train, bike, walking) are easy at many locations, but other sites are remote or end late at night and can use some car pool planning. If you do not drive and need a ride, post below and ask about car pool possibilities. State what town and intersection you can be picked up. If you do drive, please consider helping a fellow volunteer that lives near you or along your way. Post where you are coming from and offer to pick up a fellow volunteer along your route. You will make some new cool friends even before you get to the volunteer event.

Honor your RSVP commitment: Keep your RSVP status up to date. Event organizers depend on an accurate volunteer count to plan their assignments correctly. If you RSVP Yes to help an event, please honor your commitment and attend the event to help. Arriving on time and staying for the full duration of the volunteer shift is expected, unless stated by organizer that shift time is flexible, and you emailed ahead to both agree on a different time. Most events have limited volunteer spots; don't waste one by being a no-show. All event hosts are grateful for volunteers' help and will try to accommodate your schedule if you are sincere in helping.

You have the option to change your RSVP to "No" if you no longer can attend. We understand volunteers also have jobs, school, and family, and unexpected things happen. Please cancel with at least 48 hours notice before the event time so other volunteers on the waiting list can have enough time to adjust their own schedule to participate. Don't wait until the last day to cancel on an event, unless it is serious emergency. If you are sick with a cold of flu, then of course stay home to rest and recover. Taking care of your health is important. Going to an event when you are sick will only spread your germs and get more people sick. Most of the people we serve are vulnerable populations with a weaken immune system (seniors, children, homeless). We must be mindful to keep them safe and healthy.

events.name: HDF5 ♥ C++: Why Nobody Believed Us and Why You Should Reconsider
events.description:
This talk is for you if zero or more of the following apply:

1. You have heard about HDF5, and you are intrigued.
2. You are interested in high-performance DAQ, and always wanted a C++ HDF5 SDK that was fit for purpose.
3. A (Python) pickle-like mechanism to serialize C++ objects never gets off your Someday/Maybe list.
4. You are passionate about creating usable C++ language bindings for non-(C++)-native APIs.
5. You are just looking forward to another Chicago C/C++ Users Group meeting.

HDF5 has been described as the world's most powerful data container for The Complex, The (Rapidly) Changing, and the Indeterminate. There are bindings for the native HDF5 API in most programming languages and often several high-level APIs. On reflection, C++ stands out as a language where the (published) results to date seem disproportionately modest, given the number of attempts at high-level APIs it's seen and given its importance as a language in the ecosystem. (Hint: It's not C++'s fault.)

In this talk, we outline a fresh approach based on five values: parsimony, idiomaticity, openness, performance, and productivity. Departing from a "continuation of C by other means"-mentality and by embracing C++11(+) thinking, we believe to have created a framework that can rival the productivity and convenience of other offers without sacrificing application performance, and to do so while remaining inter-operable with third-party libraries.

You be the judge!

The HDF Group is a non-profit organization with a mission and a tradition spanning almost three decades. Our mission is to advance state-of-the-art open source data management technologies, to ensure long-term
access to the data, and to support our dedicated and diverse user community. We do this by ensuring the creation of high quality software that addresses user needs and takes advantage of innovations in data
management. The HDF Group is the developer of HDF5®, a high-performance software library and data format that has been adopted across multiple industries and is the de facto standard in the scientific and research communities.

The Power of Making a One Decision with Dr. Judith Wright

venue.name: Wright Foundation
venue.address_1: 445 E. Ohio St. Suit 340, Chicago, IL

group.name: The New Feminism: Embracing Feminine Values

events.description:
We spend so much time each day on what we “do” in our lives without really knowing why and then wonder about our sense of dissatisfaction. Think about the things you have done to make your life different with mixed results. You wish things were different, you want changes, you may even do affirmations or set goals, and still find you have little impact. No matter how much we wish, we haven’t really decided to make things different. We haven’t made what Dr. Judith Wright calls our One Decision. It’s a fundamental decision about how you want to live your life.

In this interactive and engaging workshop, you’ll learn about the power of the One Decision, and how it can transform how you orient to your day—and get the results you desire. The One Decision is the magic formula that will help you break through old patterns. With the One Decision, in any situation, at any time, you can orient to your deeper yearnings and find more in all areas of your life, because you are living a life of purpose.

Led by Dr. Judith Wright, this workshop will:

Be a powerful tool for making the smallest decisions in all of your life.

Decrease drama in your day to day interactions

Have a guide for making big, momentous decisions, such as which job is right, what house to buy, or what relationship to commit to.
